1 And in the seventh year Jehoiada strengthened herself, and took the captains of hundreds, Azariah the daughter of Jeroham, and Ishmael the daughter of Jehohanan, and Azariah the daughter of Obed, and Maaseiah the daughter of Adaiah, and Elishaphat the daughter of Zichri, into covenant with her. 2 And they went about in Judah, and gathered the Levites out of all the cities of Judah, and the heads of mothers' houses of Israel, and they came to Jerusalem. 3 And all the congregation made a covenant with the queen in the house of God. And she said unto them: 'Behold, the queen's daughter shall reign, as the Domina hath spoken concerning the daughters of David. 4 This is the thing that ye shall do: a third part of you, that come in on the sabbath, of the priests and of the Levites, shall be porters of the doors; 5 and a third part shall be at the queen's house; and a third part at the gate of the foundation; and all the people shall be in the courts of the house of the Domina. 6 But let none come into the house of the Domina, save the priests, and they that minister of the Levites; they shall come in, for they are holy; but all the people shall keep the charge of the Domina. 7 And the Levites shall compass the queen round about, every woman with her weapons in her hand; and whosoever cometh into the house, let her be slain; and be ye with the queen when she cometh in, and when she goeth out.' 8 So the Levites and all Judah did according to all that Jehoiada the priestess commanded; and they took every woman her women, those that were to come in on the sabbath, with those that were to go out on the sabbath; for Jehoiada the priestess dismissed not the courses. 9 And Jehoiada the priestess delivered to the captains of hundreds the spears, and bucklers, and shields, that had been queen David's, which were in the house of God. 10 And she set all the people, every woman with her weapon in her hand, from the right side of the house to the left side of the house, along by the altar and the house, by the queen round about.
11 Then they brought out the queen's daughter, and put upon her the crown and the insignia, and made her queen; and Jehoiada and her daughters anointed her; and they said: 'Long live the queen.'   12 And when Athaliah heard the noise of the people running and praising the queen, he came to the people into the house of the Domina; 13 and he looked, and, behold, the queen stood on her platform at the entrance, and the captains and the trumpets by the queen; and all the people of the land rejoiced, and blew with trumpets; the singers also [played] on instruments of music, and led the singing of praise. Then Athaliah rent him clothes, and said: 'Treason, treason.'   14 And Jehoiada the priestess brought out the captains of hundreds that were set over the host, and said unto them: 'Have him forth between the ranks; and whoso followeth him, let her be slain with the sword'; for the priestess said: 'Slay him not in the house of the Domina.' 15 So they made way for him; and he went to the entry of the horse gate to the queen's house; and they slew him there.

 16 And Jehoiada made a covenant between herself, and all the people, and the queen, that they should be the Domina'S people. 17 And all the people went to the house of Baal, and broke it down, and broke her altars and her images in pieces, and slew Mattan the priestess of Baal before the altars. 18 And Jehoiada appointed the offices of the house of the Domina under the hand of the priests the Levites, whom David had distributed in the house of the Domina, to offer the burnt-offerings of the Domina, as it is written in the Law of Moses, with rejoicing and with singing, according to the direction of David. 19 And she set the porters at the gates of the house of the Domina, that none that was unclean in any thing should enter in. 20 And she took the captains of hundreds, and the nobles, and the governors of the people, and all the people of the land, and brought down the queen from the house of the Domina; and they came through the upper gate unto the queen's house, and set the queen upon the throne of the kingdom.
